destination.label: パルマ・デ・マリョルカ

content.travelGuideName: パルマ・デ・マリョルカ

content.title: S'Angel, tapas bar with world flavours

introduction.small: In the heart of Palma de Mallorca, S'Angel offers a few singular tapas that fuse Mediterranean with international flavours.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: S'Angel, tapas bar with world flavours

paragraphs.text:
The terrace directly gives onto the famous Es Baluard Museum. The tastefully decorated patio reveals the cosy atmosphere that prevails all around the restaurant, with refined wooden tables and bright interiors. Since it opened in the centre of Palma de Mallorca, S'Angel is always packed. Tapas are generous and affordable, attracting a large clientele. As for the menu, it offers fusion food, blending Mediterranean gastronomy with Latin America and East Asia.
Share a few unusual sweet and savoury Vietnamese rolls, mixing marinated salmon with mango and avocado. Then continue with a duck breast fillet in raspberry sauce and spicy green pepper before ending on a sweet grilled pineapple, served with mango coulis and vanilla ice cream. To be paired with an island wine – to be enjoyed in moderation – carefully selected by the restaurant. Bask in the late afternoon sun with your friends and cherish the moment.

S'Angel
Plaça de la Porta de Santa Catalina, 7A
07012 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 77 36 61

Menu: around 22 EUR

content.title: Naan lends street food some prestige

introduction.small: Naan showcases worldwide street food inspired cuisine.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Naan lends street food some prestige

paragraphs.text:
In Santa Catalina, the trendiest neighbourhood when it comes to fine dining, Naan Street Food is one of these restaurants that should not be missed. There, the atmosphere is elegant and relaxed, with an open kitchen, high chairs and tables and the Rolling Stones or Lou Reed as background music. As for the food, it displays some fusional links between all street foods from around the world. Regulars and tourists alike gather to enjoy a Ceviche Naan, blending Peru and India, a revisited American Lobster Roll or the famous fish tacos, real star of the menu. Chef Nicolas Malenchini offers whole or half servings, which is an ideal way to try different flavours. It is also customary to share several dishes with your friends. Do not hesitate and live this pleasant and joyful moment to the full!

Naan Street Food
Carrer de Caro, 16
07013 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 91 55 22

www.naanstreetfood.com ﻿

Menu: around 25 EUR

content.title: Hotel Cap Rocat, sublime fortress

introduction.small: A gem among the hotels of Mallorca, this former military building will make you want to be locked up forever.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hotel Cap Rocat, sublime fortress

paragraphs.text:
Located in the bay of Cala Blava, this ancient fort does not immediately reveal its hotel functions. In Mallorca's most preserved and chic area, 20 minutes from Palma, this hotel is now a member of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World". Completely renovated in 2010, the building has kept its military architecture, and is one with the breath taking landscape surrounding it - marine and ornithological reserves. Once you have walked through the imposing door, you will not grow tired of admiring the historic buildings, which have been converted into private lounges. As for the sumptuous suites with terrace and private patio - on the side of the cliff -, they will leave you speechless. Overlooking the bay, as the sea unfolds before you, it will feel like an enchanted daydream. Private access to the sea and nature reserve, around the former pier, will provide memorable swimming in crystal clear water. Finally, since luxury is never-ending in Cap Rocat, you may choose to lay by the hotel's outdoor swimming pool, filled with salt water, or by the Spa pool buried 12 metres deep, perfectly lit by the Mallorcan sun shining through its glass ceiling.

Hotel Cap Rocat
Carretera Enderrocat, s/n
07609 Cala Blava

+34 971 74 78 78

www.caprocat.com

Rooms: from 600 EUR

content.title: Musical interlude at Valldemossa charterhouse

introduction.small: In the heart of the Serra de Tramuntana valley, in a cloister formerly occupied by Carthusian monks from 1399 to 1835, Chopin composed his preludes.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Musical interlude at Valldemossa charterhouse

paragraphs.text:
During the winter of 1838, the writer George Sand, her two children and the composer Frederic Chopin, settled in the heart of the village of Valldemossa, in cell no. 4 – three rooms and a garden - of a former chartreuse cloister. Located 17 kilometres from Palma and 400 metres above sea level, this haven was to improve the health of the musician who was suffering from tuberculosis. Camille Pleyel even had a piano delivered from Paris. Charmed by the poetry of the area and sublime landscapes, Frederic Chopin composed his cycle of 24 Preludes, op. 28 and his 2nd Ballade, op. 38 here. At the end of the season, Frederic's health continued to deteriorate, and the small group had to rush back to France. Over winter, the myth was born. Chopin or George Sand lovers will enjoy visiting the furnished rooms where the two artists lived, but also the library which holds the works that only the monks were allowed to borrow. The chartreuse offers a beautiful view of the Serra de Tramuntana valley. Not to be missed at the end of the tour: some of Chopin's works performed by a local pianist.

Valldemossa Chartreuse
Plaça de la Cartoixa, s/n
07170 Valldemossa

+34 971 61 21 06

www.cartujadevalldemossa.com

content.title: The Castell de Bellver praises the circle

introduction.small: The castle of Bellver - or "castell de Bellver" in Catalan -, an amazing circular Gothic fortress, offers a splendid panorama on the Palma bay.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Castell de Bellver praises the circle

paragraphs.text:
In the fourteenth century, when peace was secured between his kingdom and the crown of Aragon, James II of Mallorca decided to have his royal residence built in the shape of a circular fortress. Located on the Bosc de Bellver, a hill covered with pine trees, it is located three kilometres from the historic centre of Palma. Today, it has become a very important museum of archaeology, painting and numismatics – yet used to be a coin factory in the 19th century - this Gothic castle can be visited seven days a week. Notice its dungeon, which dominates a gigantic arms' courtyard on two floors, as well as its interior courtyard, built around a well, which hosts many cultural events. The arcades on the ground floor conceal Roman statues gifted by Cardinal Antonio Despuig y Dameto (1745-1813), a native of the island. The royal apartments are also worth a visit, but the most beautiful jewel of the castle is undoubtedly the panoramic view of the city, port and bay from its high walls.

Castell de Bellver
Carrer Camilo José Cela, s/n
07014 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 73 50 65

www.palma.cat/portal/PALMA/

content.title: Royal Palace of Almudaina, Mallorca's Alcazar

introduction.small: Next to the cathedral, this proud hidalgo palace took on its present shape in the thirteenth century, on the site of a Moorish Alcazar.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Royal Palace of Almudaina, Mallorca's Alcazar

paragraphs.text:
Almudaina - which means "citadel" in Arabic - is a true concentrate of Mallorcan history. After the foundation of Palma the Roman in 123 BC, a fortress was erected here in the 10th century and transformed into a princely residence under the Umayyad caliphate of Cordoba. After the conquest of the island by James I of Aragon in 1229, the old Moorish castle became a real Catalan palace, revamped during the reign of Philip II of Spain. "Nothing is more proud, more characteristic, more hidalgo than this manor," George Sand wrote of this magnificent building which remains, to this day, the official residence of the King and Queen of Spain during their visits to the Balearic Islands. Besides the Palace of the King and that of the Queen, the citadel, which overlooks the port and bay of Palma, houses an independent building called "Salo del Tinell" - comparable in splendour to the Palace of the Kings of Mallorca's Throne in Perpignan - and a remarkable royal chapel. Mudéjar style and Levantine gothic architecture are intertwined here, all decorated with numerous Flemish tapestries dating from the 14th to the 16th century.

Palau de La Almudaina
Carrer del Palau Reial, s/n
07001 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 21 41 34

www.patrimonionacional.es

content.title: Puro Oasis Urbano, modernity reigns

introduction.small: Whether you come to Mallorca for its vibrant nightlife or to enjoy a well-deserved rest, you will inevitably be happy at Puro Oasis Urbano.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Puro Oasis Urbano, modernity reigns

paragraphs.text:
An eight-minute walk from Palma Cathedral, the Puro is a former 18th century mansion, decorated by Swedish designer Gabrielle Jangeby. Its bohemian chic atmosphere has been borrowing from cosmopolitan urban influences since 2010. Nevertheless, the hotel has retained elements from its Arab-Andalusian architecture: the arches of the balconies overlooking the interior courtyard. The rooms open onto the patio or rooftops of the old town, white dominates with a deliberately clean style. On the terrace, the mellow music calls for a relaxing break by the pool and, should you want to head for the waves, a shuttle will take you to the PuroBeach Club, right on the water. This hotel, a wonderful blend of design, trendy music, modern art and Mediterranean cuisine, will delight a clientele interested in Mallorca's eclectic soul.

Puro Oasis Urbano
Carrer de Montenegro, 12
07012 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 42 54 50

www.purohotel.com/en
Rooms: from 104 EUR

content.title: Sant Francesc Hotel Singular, the good life

introduction.small: Modern and chic, this five-star address opened in 2015, and is already one of the most popular establishments on the island.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Sant Francesc Hotel Singular, the good life

paragraphs.text:
Welcome to one of the most elegant addresses in Palma, a 19th century mansion with unique view of the rooftops of the city. From the spectacular rooftop terrace, imagine yourself sipping a deliciously fresh smoothie served by the 30-square-metre salt-water pool, and from the comfort of your deckchair, look out at the sea of ochre tiles of the old town and the bell tower of Sant Francesc Church. Magical! The 42 rooms are spacious and decorated in contemporary and chic style - perfect while the original frescoes and exposed beams remind us of the unique character of the place. You will also be able to discover the menu of the Quadrat restaurant, very much appreciated by gourmets. In a few months, this Mallorca address has earned a great reputation.

Sant Francesc Hotel Singular
Plaça de Sant Francesc, 5
07001 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 49 50 00

www.hotelsantfrancesc.com/en

Rooms: from 189 EUR

content.title: Kid friendly activities

introduction.small: After the beach and hiking, the Aquarium of Palma and El Arenal Aqualand will enchant little ones and delight bigger ones.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kid friendly activities

paragraphs.text:
Spreading over 12,000 m2, the Palma aquarium is one of the largest in Europe. It is a must-see, with different ecosystems - the Mediterranean Sea, but also the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian Oceans - represented in 55 basins, where nearly 700 species can be found. You may observe, with the eyes of a child, the banks of colourful exotic fish. Highlight of the show: watch some sharks swim in 3.5 million litres of water, 8.5 metres deep, behind a huge window. You will also have the opportunity to contemplate a prodigious collection of living corals. If this excursion has given you the urge to jump into the water, run to Aqualand el Arenal, ideal for family fun. The smaller ones will swim with a giant dragon in Dragonland while the big ones may get dizzy at the Kamikaze water slide... A total of sixteen attractions will allow you to spend a memorable day in a swimsuit, between laughs and shivers!

Palma Aquarium
Carrer Manuela de los Herreros i Sorà, 21
07610 Palma de Mallorca
+34 971 74 61 04
palmaaquarium.com/eng

Aqualand el Arenal
Autovia Palma - Arenal, km 15
07600 El Arenal
+34 971 44 00 00
www.aqualand.es/elarenal/

content.title: El Tapas de Flanigan all about relaxation

introduction.small: From its open kitchen, this tavern delivers all the classic tapas recipes.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: El Tapas de Flanigan all about relaxation

paragraphs.text:
Famous interior designer, Lázaro Rosa-Violán, a neoclassical Catalan design guru - the same architect who decorated the Tast Club in Palma - redid El Tapas Flanigan in 2014. The tavern's pretty terrace overflows onto the touristy Passeig Mallorca. The open kitchen in the centre of the restaurant, the huge bar where you can set down your plate, the bistro tables and aged wooden benches – as well as the blue and white tiles with pink compass rose motif, lend the place a sailor's tavern feel. Traditional tapas, Spain's culinary essences, are served for the visitors' greatest pleasure - dishes based on fried fish, grilled pepper, squid cakes, ham and cheese, cold meat, tortillas, rice, beans ... and clams. For dessert, the panna cotta with fruit pulp wins all. You will also notice a solid wine list - by the glass or bottle - which starts at a low price with a Rioja and culminates with a white Ribas.

El Tapas de Flanigan
Passeig de Mallorca, 20
07012 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 67 90 17

flanigan.es
Menu: from 20 EUR

content.title: Canela defines Palma's new shoreline

introduction.small: This popular bistro in downtown Palma, run by Fabián Fuster and Irene Rigo, serves Mediterranean cuisine infused with strong Asian accents.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Canela defines Palma's new shoreline

paragraphs.text:
A pretty wooden terrace, shoplike front, a room decorated like a Parisian bistro, with mezzanine and open kitchen: the Canela restaurant has quickly become a popular address in Palma. Delicious dishes mixing Mediterranean and Asian cuisine are served simply on small bare tables. The menu is indeed resolutely fusion: soft shell crab tempura served with spicy sweet melon salad, or boar cheek with Korean spices, Alaska Black Cod with Cambodian ones or, to summon Japan on your plate, pork and shrimp gyozas. If you prefer more familiar dishes, know that ceviche, tuna tartar or Waguy beef are also available. For the sweet tooth and hungry, they can devour a hot-cold raspberry and dark chocolate dessert. Note that chef Fabián Fuster, who previously set down his knives in London and Amsterdam, cooks exclusively with seasonal products.

Canela
Carrer Sant Jaume, 13
07012 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 71 03 14

www.canelabistro.es

Menu: from 30 EUR

content.title: Iberian delights at the Tast Club

introduction.small: The discreet Tast Club offers local cuisine in an English club atmosphere.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Iberian delights at the Tast Club

paragraphs.text:
This restaurant is hardly visible from the outside, but is a must see for those looking to taste Iberian specialties. Decorated with care by the Catalan neoclassical designer Lázaro Rosa-Violán, the Tast Club revisits the British club feel with soft, cream, honey, stone and woodwork touches. Feel free to indulge in ibérico bellota ham, fine potato and onion tortillas, monkfish filets with paprika and, of course, all sorts of tapas: anchovies with vinaigrette, sardines with poached truffle quail egg, marinated mussels, Parmesan fried artichokes. Finally, the Madrilène style tripe, Iberian pork steak or the tomato sauce cod will complete a tenuous but mouth-watering menu. Will there be room left for dessert?

Tast Club
Carrer de Sant Jaume, 6
07012 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 71 01 50

www.tast.com

Menu: from 40 EUR

content.title: Hotel Java, relaxation and family holidays

introduction.small: Thanks to its location and excellent facilities, this property will appeal to all those looking for comfortable and affordable accommodation.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hotel Java, relaxation and family holidays

paragraphs.text:
This modern complex, fully renovated in 2013, is an excellent compromise to enjoy Mallorca without breaking the bank. All amenities are available for guests whether they are traveling for business or leisure: pool and towel service, solarium, Wi-Fi, gym, sauna and steam bath, jacuzzi and above all... Ca ' N Pastilla beach at the foot of the hotel. As for Playa de Palma, the largest beach on the island, you will only need to walk 100 metres to lay down your towel. Five minutes from the airport and seven minutes from Palma de Mallorca, you can reach the main attractions of the city in a very short time. And, to discover fantastic fish without going to the other end of the island, know that the aquarium of Palma, one of the largest in Europe, is nearby. The perfect opportunity to see rays and sharks up close without having to put on a diving suit!

Hotel Java
Calle de Goleta, 7
07610 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 26 27 76

www.hotel-java.bghotels.com

Rooms: from 76 EUR

content.title: The cathedral, colossus of Palma

introduction.small: Nicknamed "La Seu", the gigantic cathedral of Santa María is taller than the Cologne cathedral. It took almost four centuries to build.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The cathedral, colossus of Palma

paragraphs.text:
Above the medieval fortifications, the colossal Cathedral of Santa María dominates the whole Palma de Mallorca bay. In pure Catalan Gothic style, the roof is practically flat and the vaulted height - 44 metres -, made even more impressive by its reduced length - 121 metres long by 55 wide – is vertiginous. Construction started in 1229 on decision of the King of Aragon to replace the great mosque of Madina Mayurqa. James I the Conqueror had taken over the Balearic Islands from the Muslims. It was consecrated 117 years later. It took 255 years to erect its 160,000 square metres of interior space. The famous master-builder and Mallorca artist, Guillem Sagrera, who conceived the Cathedral of Perpignan, Castel Nuovo of Naples and the Lodge of Palma, completed the building in the middle of the 15th century. The cathedral was restored at the beginning of the 20th century by Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí.

Catedral de Santa María de Palma de Mallorca
Plaça de la Seu
07001 Palma de Mallorca

+34 902 02 24 45

catedraldemallorca.org

content.title: Palma high up at Sumaq

introduction.small: Chef Irene Gutiérrez has become the ambassador of Nikkei gastronomy on the island of Mallorca.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Palma high up at Sumaq

paragraphs.text:
Originally from Cusco, the capital of the Incas in the heart of the Andes, Chef Irene Gutiérrez takes Palma even higher with an open kitchen that plays the partition of Peruvian fusion, known as "Nikkei" or "Nippo-Peruvian ". This original cuisine comes from the strong Japanese immigration in Peru at the end of the 19th century. Ceviche, the Peruvian national dish, is thus enriched with soy sauce, sesame or wasabi that subtly softens the lime. The Sumaq, nestled in the Santa Catalina district, offers a dozen different types of ceviche. Building on the success of its 2013 opening, the restaurant had to relocate to a larger - 75 seats - and more elegant room. Here, go for a Secuencia de ceviches de pesacado after a Causa de pulpo al olivo - tomato stuffed potato, avocado and octopus, all topped with Peruvian olive cream. Refresh your palate with a glass of Verdejo, dry Spanish white wine.

Sumaq
Carrer de Cotoner, 44
07013 Palma de Mallorca

+34 696 52 67 58

www.restaurantesumaq.com

Menu: from 50 EUR

content.title: Posada Terra Santa, paradise on earth

introduction.small: In the centre of old Palma, a confidential address, away from the hustle and bustle of the beaches.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Posada Terra Santa, paradise on earth

paragraphs.text:
This charming hotel is a secluded gem in the heart of the old town of Palma. This 16th century manor will delight anyone who loves history-filled places. Behind the secular stones of Posada Terra Santa, enjoy a pleasant stay within the intimate and refined private apartments. For a memorable experience, climb the terrace overlooking the rooftops and, while enjoying - as you should - the small swimming pool heated to 28 ° C year-round, admire the silhouette of the basilica of Sant Francesc. From Posada Terra Santa, you may easily reach the Santa María Cathedral in Palma de Mallorca - a masterpiece of Gothic art - the Royal Palace of Almudaina - one of the residences of the Spanish royal family dating back to the 14th century - or Plaça Mayor, full of charm with its small shops. For athletic excursions, it will only take a few minutes to reach Cala Major beach.

Posada Terra Santa
Carrer de la Posada de Terra Santa, 5
07001 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 21 47 42

www.posadaterrasanta.com

Rooms: from 196 EUR

content.title: Koh spices up market flavours

introduction.small: In the shadow of La Seu, this restaurant offers original Asian cuisine with local market produce.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Koh spices up market flavours

paragraphs.text:
Close to the Santa Catalina covered market, famous for its local products, which you can enjoy on the go, the Koh displays irresistible Asian charm in a cosmopolitan and arty district. The gin kumquat cocktail, originally from China and Malaysia, is essential before enjoying a Thai salad appetizer, followed by Aberdeen Angus black beef, served on a very creative plate. Similarly, curry dishes - Thai green, Malaysian red, Indonesian fish - are always made with products from either a vegetable garden in Puigpunyent in the Serra de la Tramuntana, or in terms of the herbs, from the interior courtyard of the restaurant, or Santa Catalina market, which also provides the cellar with first choice wines. The room is simple, with light wooden tables, bare walls and refined banquettes. But no matter, the show will be on your plate.

Koh
Carrer de Servet, 15
07013 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 28 70 39

www.facebook.com/kohmallorca/

Menu: from 37 EUR

content.title: Pilar and Joan Miró Foundation

introduction.small: This exciting visit into Miró's intimacy will allow you to better know this true artist who was all at once a great painter, sculptor, engraver, and ceramist.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Pilar and Joan Miró Foundation

paragraphs.text:
Joan Miró waited 63 years for his dream to materialize: to be able to create in a large workshop. In 1954, his architect friend Josep Lluís Sert designed an open space where Palma de Mallorca's light would generously flow. When the artist settled there in 1956, he was coming back to his roots: his mother was from Mallorca and his wife Pilar, a native of the island. Created by Joan Miró and his wife two years before the artist's death in 1983, the foundation nestles in the heart of this incredible building. More than 6,000 works are presented to the public - paintings, sculptures, drawings - as well as part of Miró's vast correspondence, a collection of 5,000 newspapers or magazines, photographs and books from his personal library. Walk inside and around the building: water, concrete and light juxtapose with Miró's intense canvases painted in primary colours. The artist's studio remained practically untouched, with unfinished canvases still on their easels and open paint jars. The garden, quiet and charming, displays several sculptures and a café, where you can sit and let your thoughts run free.

Fundació Pilar i Joan Miró
Carrer Joan de Saridakis, 29
07015 Palma de Mallorca

+34 971 70 14 20

www.miromallorca.com

content.title: La Serra de Tramuntana, Mallorca's other face

introduction.small: Through the marked trails of the GR 221, discover pastoral Mallorca, inhabited by endemic species, more than 1,000 meters above sea level.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: La Serra de Tramuntana, Mallorca's other face

paragraphs.text:
The North wind - which blows from the mainland, rushes into the Gulf of Lions and then spreads around the North-western part of the island - giving its name to the main mountain range of Mallorca: the Serra de Tramuntana. This unique area, which is 1,445 meters high, is covered in snow during winter, subject to heavy rain, in stark contrast with the arid climate of most of the island and usual Mediterranean standards. In the Serra de Tramuntana, nature and biodiversity lovers will be delighted! While the Spanish Air Force has settled on the highest peak (the Puig Major, which has been classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2011), other summits are fully open to trekkers thanks to the GR 221, otherwise known as "dry stone road", a great hiking trail marked along 149,5 kilometres! Be sure to take a stroll along the sumptuous Puig de Massanella and Puig de Galatzó. They will open the doors to lesser known, magnificent, and wild Mallorca.

www.conselldemallorca.net

content.title: Fornalutx, one of Spain's most beautiful villages

introduction.small: This medieval village perched on a hill represents the memory of the island. Stroll along its steep streets and enjoy the charm of its authenticity.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Fornalutx, one of Spain's most beautiful villages

paragraphs.text: North of Mallorca, 33 kilometres from Palma, Fornalutx remains the first (and for now, the only) Balearic village included in the list of "most beautiful villages of Spain". Its tranquillity and the typical charm of its houses attract beautiful stone lovers from around the world. Far from the beaches, you will climb a hundred metres up the cobbled streets to reach the main square of the village. On the way, hundred-year-old fountains will quench your thirst while a picturesque setting will unfold before your amazed eyes. Do not forget to stop by Ca n'Arbona, the current city hall, or Casa d'Amunt, Bàlitx Ca'n Xandre, Ca'n Ballester and Ca ' N Bisbal. You may also go on outings to the watchtower of Ses Barques, where a charming little restaurant awaits you ... and another sublime vista.

content.title: Three beautiful beaches in Mallorca

introduction.small: Between immense rocks, on the white sand that makes the water crystal clear, bathing in Mallorca is a true moment of grace. To your swimsuits!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Three beautiful beaches in Mallorca

paragraphs.text: Heading Southeast, 6.5 kilometres from Colònia de Sant Jordi, Es Trenc beach offers clear water, fine sand, and a wild feel, the beach stretches for almost two kilometres. Very popular with those who love tranquillity - a small part of the site is also occupied by nudists - Es Trenc is a special place. Still south-east, 8.5 kilometres from Santanyí, the El caló des Moro cove and its turquoise waters emerge between two cliffs of white rocks. It takes a short walk to get there, but the surprise is well worth the effort. Enjoy the empty and quiet beach in the morning. The west coast of Mallorca is practically uninhabited because of its terrain. Following a winding road that crosses mountains, stop at Sa Calobra, a village by the sea. Its pebble beach, clear water, and charming port attract visitors. For a memorable bathing experience, we recommend you reach the bed of the torrent of Pareis - dry during summer - from Sa Calobra. Surrounded by cliffs, in the heart of a real stone cathedral, you will emerge in a creek with turquoise water. An idyllic and stunning moment!

content.title: Inca market in the heart of the island

introduction.small: For a day trip, head to Inca in the heart of the island, the third largest city in Mallorca after Palma and Manacor.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Inca market in the heart of the island

paragraphs.text:
No, the city of Inca has no connection with the famous pre-Columbian civilization of the Andes - its name dates back to the time when the city was under Muslim rule. In Inca, those who enjoy cultural and pious visits will love lingering at Santa María la Mayor church, the former convent of Sant Domingo, the convent of Sant Francesc, or the monastery of Sant Bartomeu. After discovering these places, for more down-to-earth pleasures, make sure to take a long break at the market held every Thursday, from 8:00 am to 1:30 pm, in part covered and also spread out over several streets – it is one of the main markets of Mallorca. Lovers of fine bottles may spend time in the numerous cellars which provide restaurants serving typical local dishes. Outside the city, the many leather factory stores – making up the city's reputation – will offer a chance to find jackets, bags, belts, and a variety of pretty tanned accessories.

Inca market
Gran Vía Colon
07300 Inca

+34 971 50 57 45

origin.label: パルマ・デ・マリョルカ
